"**On Top of the World** " is a song by the American [rock](/wiki/Rock_music
"Rock music") band [Imagine Dragons](/wiki/Imagine_Dragons "Imagine Dragons")
for their major-label debut [extended play](/wiki/Extended_play "Extended
play") _[Continued Silence](/wiki/Continued_Silence "Continued Silence")_
(2012), where it appears as the third track. The song also appears on their
debut studio album _[Night Visions](/wiki/Night_Visions "Night Visions")_
(2012) as the fifth track. "On Top of the World" was released digitally as a
single on March 18, 2013.

##
Composition[[edit](/w/index.php?title=On_Top_of_the_World_\(Imagine_Dragons_song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Composition")]

![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Gnome-mime-sound-openclipart.svg/50px-Gnome-mime-sound-openclipart.svg.png) |  ["On Top of the World"](/wiki/File:Imagine_Dragons_-_%22On_Top_of_the_World%22_\(Audio_sample\).ogg "File:Imagine Dragons - "On Top of the World" \(Audio sample\).ogg") ![](data:image/png,%89PNG%0D%0A%1A%0A%00%00%00%0DIHDR%00%00%00%01%00%00%00%01%08%02%00%00%00%90wS%DE%00%00%00%01sRGB%00%AE%CE%1C%E9%00%00%00%09pHYs%00%00%0B%13%00%00%0B%13%01%00%9A%9C%18%00%00%00%07tIME%07%DB%0B%0A%17%041%80%9B%E7%F2%00%00%00%19tEXtComment%00Created%20with%20GIMPW%81%0E%17%00%00%00%0CIDAT%08%D7c%60%60%60%00%00%00%04%00%01'4'%0A%00%00%00%00IEND%AEB%60%82)[](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/d4/Imagine_Dragons_-_%22On_Top_of_the_World%22_%28Audio_sample%29.ogg) "On Top of the World" is a sharp contrast to the darker, thematic songs on _Night Visions_.

"On Top of the World" primarily features [guitar](/wiki/Guitar "Guitar") and
[piano](/wiki/Piano "Piano") instrumentation, with vocals performed by lead
singer [Dan Reynolds](/wiki/Dan_Reynolds_\(musician\) "Dan Reynolds
\(musician\)").[1] Originally published in the key of [C major](/wiki/C_major
"C major"),[1] the song itself expresses a celebration of accomplishment for
the band after striving for years to become successful.[2] The song
incorporates the chord progression of C-F-C-Dm in the verses, and F-C-G-Dm in
the chorus and bridge, with the pre-chorus using Am and G to create a
different break in the song.[3] The song "On Top of the World" is found to be
a positive, upbeat track, unlike other songs found on _Night Visions_ ,
including "[Bleeding Out](/wiki/Bleeding_Out_\(song\) "Bleeding Out
\(song\)")" and "[Hear Me](/wiki/Hear_Me_\(song\) "Hear Me
\(song\)")".[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

The song is built on a sample of [minimalist](/wiki/Minimalist_music
"Minimalist music") composer [Steve Reich](/wiki/Steve_Reich "Steve Reich")'s
"[Clapping Music](/wiki/Clapping_Music "Clapping Music")" from 1972.

## In
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=On_Top_of_the_World_\(Imagine_Dragons_song\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: In media")]

Imagine Dragons performed the song live on the Australian version of _[The X
Factor](/wiki/The_X_Factor_\(Australian_TV_series\) "The X Factor \(Australian
TV series\)")_ in 2013.[4]

"On Top of the World" was licensed for inclusion on the soundtrack of [EA
Sports](/wiki/EA_Sports "EA Sports") game, _[FIFA 13](/wiki/FIFA_13 "FIFA
13")_. The band, longtime fans of the [_FIFA_ video game
series](/wiki/FIFA_\(video_game_series\) "FIFA \(video game series\)"),
reacted positively to its inclusion in the game and stated that it would be "a
lot of fun hearing the track play while we are doing bicycle kicks and
screaming at the screen."[5] It also served as the opening theme of the short-
lived [CBS](/wiki/CBS "CBS") comedy series
_[Partners](/wiki/Partners_\(2012_TV_series\) "Partners \(2012 TV
series\)")_.[6] "On Top of the World" was performed by the [PS22
Chorus](/wiki/PS22_Chorus "PS22 Chorus") during [Barack
Obama](/wiki/Barack_Obama "Barack Obama")'s [second United States presidential
inauguration](/wiki/Second_inauguration_of_Barack_Obama "Second inauguration
of Barack Obama").[7] It also featured in [Konami](/wiki/Konami "Konami")
video game _[Pro Evolution Soccer 2013](/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2013 "Pro
Evolution Soccer 2013")_ as well as being used in a [Samsung Galaxy Note
8.0](/wiki/Samsung_Galaxy_Note_8.0 "Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0") advert.

The song was featured prominently in the film _[The Incredible Burt
Wonderstone](/wiki/The_Incredible_Burt_Wonderstone "The Incredible Burt
Wonderstone")_ several times.

The song is featured in the _[Liv and Maddie](/wiki/Liv_and_Maddie "Liv and
Maddie")_ episode "Twin-a-Rooney", performed by [Dove
Cameron](/wiki/Dove_Cameron "Dove Cameron") in the title role of Liv Rooney.
Dove Cameron's version appears on the compilation album _[Disney Channel Play
It Loud](/wiki/Disney_Channel_Play_It_Loud "Disney Channel Play It Loud")_.

[Hunter Hayes](/wiki/Hunter_Hayes "Hunter Hayes") covered the song live on his
US tour.[8]

The song was used by [ESPN](/wiki/ESPN "ESPN") for their coverage of the
[NBA](/wiki/NBA_on_ESPN "NBA on ESPN") for the [2013–14 NBA
season](/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_NBA_season "2013–14 NBA season").

The song was used during [Cartoon Network](/wiki/Cartoon_Network "Cartoon
Network")'s 2013 [Hall of Game Awards](/wiki/Hall_of_Game_Awards "Hall of Game
Awards").

The song was used in trailers for the films _[The Croods](/wiki/The_Croods
"The Croods")_ (2013) and _[Island of Lemurs:
Madagascar](/wiki/Island_of_Lemurs:_Madagascar "Island of Lemurs:
Madagascar")_ (2014).

[WPVI-TV](/wiki/WPVI-TV "WPVI-TV") in [Philadelphia,
Pennsylvania](/wiki/Philadelphia,_Pennsylvania "Philadelphia, Pennsylvania")
uses the song to promote their morning news, _Action News Mornings_.

The song is used in the [Coca-Cola](/wiki/Coca-Cola "Coca-Cola") promotional
video "Moments of Happiness", shown exclusively at the [World of Coca-
Cola](/wiki/World_of_Coca-Cola "World of Coca-Cola") in [Atlanta,
Georgia](/wiki/Atlanta,_Georgia "Atlanta, Georgia").

The song was featured in the soundtracks of _[Alpha and Omega: The Legend of
the Saw Tooth Cave](/wiki/Alpha_and_Omega:_The_Legend_of_the_Saw_Tooth_Cave
"Alpha and Omega: The Legend of the Saw Tooth Cave")_ and _[The Angry Birds
Movie](/wiki/The_Angry_Birds_Movie "The Angry Birds Movie")_.

From 2013 to 2015, [Vodafone Portugal](/wiki/Vodafone_Portugal "Vodafone
Portugal") used the song in their ads for the Red phone plan.[9]

In November 2017, [Ford](/wiki/Ford "Ford") used this song in their [Black
Friday](/wiki/Black_Friday_\(shopping\) "Black Friday \(shopping\)") year-end
event sales commercial.[10]

## Music
video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=On_Top_of_the_World_\(Imagine_Dragons_song\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Music video")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/58/KubrickForLook.jpg/220px-
KubrickForLook.jpg)](/wiki/File:KubrickForLook.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:KubrickForLook.jpg "Enlarge")

The official music video satirizes a popular conspiracy theory that the Apollo
moon landings were faked with the help of director [Stanley
Kubrick](/wiki/Stanley_Kubrick "Stanley Kubrick") (pictured)

As a part of the [Palladia](/wiki/Palladia "Palladia") documentary _Imagine
Dragons: The Making of Night Visions_ , which originally aired on November 7,
2012, the band filmed a video of themselves performing "On Top of the World"
and subsequently uploaded it to [YouTube](/wiki/YouTube "YouTube").

On November 13, 2013 the band released an official music video for the
song.[11] The video satirizes a popular conspiracy theory that the 1969 [Moon
landings](/wiki/Apollo_11 "Apollo 11") were
[faked](/wiki/Moon_landing_conspiracy_theories "Moon landing conspiracy
theories"), the footage having been directed by [Stanley
Kubrick](/wiki/Stanley_Kubrick "Stanley Kubrick"), and that Kubrick then made
references to the fakery in various of his subsequent films. In the video, a
rock band similar to [the Beatles](/wiki/The_Beatles "The Beatles") (played by
the members of Imagine Dragons) pretend to be astronauts for the faked moon
landing. The taping goes awry as fans of the band stream into the sound stage
and turn the event into a rock concert, much to the chagrin of Kubrick and
President [Richard Nixon](/wiki/Richard_Nixon "Richard Nixon"), who is also on
hand; the crowd might be discovering by being there, that the landings were
fake or just be happy to be at the concert. The people at home might be
agreeing now that the conspiracies were real, though just how many people are
aware or not is not exactly shown.[11] The video also briefly references
another popular conspiracy theory from around the same time, that Beatles
member [Paul McCartney](/wiki/Paul_McCartney "Paul McCartney") [died in
1966](/wiki/Paul_is_dead "Paul is dead") and was replaced by a [look-
alike](/wiki/Look-alike "Look-alike").[11]

The video was filmed in [Provo, Utah](/wiki/Provo,_Utah "Provo, Utah"),
Imagine Dragons' original hometown, and includes cameos from various
celebrities associated with Provo or [Brigham Young
University](/wiki/Brigham_Young_University "Brigham Young University"),
including [Jon Heder](/wiki/Jon_Heder "Jon Heder"), the cast of the TV show
_[Studio C](/wiki/Studio_C "Studio C")_ , guitarist [Robbie
Connolly](/wiki/Fictionist "Fictionist"), and members of [The New Electric
Sound](/wiki/The_New_Electric_Sound "The New Electric Sound"). [Whit
Hertford](/wiki/Whit_Hertford "Whit Hertford") plays Kubrick, and singer [Aja
Volkman](/wiki/Aja_Volkman "Aja Volkman"), Imagine Dragons frontman Dan
Reynolds' wife, appears as Reynolds' character's wife.[12]

## Commercial
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=On_Top_of_the_World_\(Imagine_Dragons_song\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Commercial performance")]

The song peaked at 79 on the US [_Billboard_ Hot 100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100
"Billboard Hot 100") and 10 on the [Hot Rock Songs](/wiki/Hot_Rock_Songs "Hot
Rock Songs") charts. It has also charted in the top ten in Australia (No. 10),
Austria (No. 6), Netherlands (No. 10), New Zealand (No. 10), Poland (No. 7),
and Portugal (No. 1). Despite having not yet been released to mainstream
radio, it has received airplay on contemporary hit stations, such as 97.1 ZHT
in Salt Lake City.

The song reached a million copies sold in the U.S. in April 2014. It's the
fourth million seller from the _Night Visions_ album.[14]
